description: From Anglo-Norman and Old French arson, from the verb ardoir, from Latin ardeō (“to burn”). Compare ardent.

entries.meaning: The crime of deliberately starting a fire with intent to cause damage.
examples: Arson, like we thought. three punks doused a car, lit it, and took off.

verbs.description: arson (third-person singular simple present arsons, present participle arsoning, simple past and past participle arsoned)

entries.meaning: (transitive, India) To illegally set fire to; to burn down in a criminal manner.

description: From Middle English arsoun, from Old French arçon, from Vulgar Latin *arciō (“saddlebow”), from Latin arcus (“bow”); compare Italian arcione, Portuguese arção, and Spanish arzón.
